pages.title: Beltanelliformis
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Neoproterozoic (Ediacaran)$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Marine$(br2)>$(O)incertae sedis (Cyanobacteria ?)$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

Beltanelliformis is an enigmatic discoid organism from the Ediacaran period that is typically found in clusters containing dozens of individuals. It is currently believed to be a macroscopic form of cyanobacteria similar in appearance to the modern algae genus Valonia.
